vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
σεβαστός, ή, όν,
venerable, reverend, august, πρᾶγμα [Refs 1st c.BC+]; θεοί, probably of deified Emperors, [Refs 1st c.AD+]
__II = Latin [NT+1st c.BC+]; ἐπὶ τοῦ πρώτου Σ. in the time of the first [Refs]; feminine Σεβαστή, = [Refs 1st c.AD+]; joined with Αὔγουστος, -ούστη, [Refs]
__II.2 name of month, “Augustus”, in Egyptian calendars,= Thoth[Refs]; in Phrygia and elsewhere, [Refs]
__II.3 σεβαστή, ἡ (i.e. ἡμέρα), the Emperor's day, the day on which his birthday or accession day was celebrated every month, [Refs 1st c.BC+]
__II.4 Σεβαστά, τά,= Σεβαστεῖα [Refs 1st c.AD+]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Luk.2.1; also called Augustan (KJV: Augustus; NIV: Imperial) at Act.27.1; "emperor" at Act.25.21,25; Caesar at Luk.2.1; 3.1;
§ (a.)august
primarily venerable, august, revered, worthy of reverence, imperial (not found in the NT); (n.) Emperor, a title of reverence or veneration; rὁ Σεβαστός, i.q. Latin Augustus, Acts 25:21, 25; Augustan, or, Sebastan, named from the city Sebaste, Acts 27:1*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: perteneciente al emperador, imperial ; el emperador (romano)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
1) 值得崇敬的
2) 羅馬皇帝的頭銜
2a) 奧古斯都的, 即取於羅馬大帝之名的
2b) 因英勇的行徑而授與古羅馬軍團, 軍隊或軍營的榮譽頭銜 (徒 25:21; 25:25; 27:1)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
1) 值得崇敬的
2) 罗马皇帝的头衔
2a) 奥古斯都的, 即取于罗马大帝之名的
2b) 因英勇的行径而授与古罗马军团, 军队或军营的荣誉头衔 (徒 25:21; 25:25; 27:1)
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: thánh thượng; Hoàng Đế La Mã; Au-gút-tơ danh hiệu hoàng đế La Mã
